gov.nasa.worldwind.render
Class ExtrudedPolygon

java.lang.Object
  gov.nasa.worldwind.avlist.AVListImpl
      gov.nasa.worldwind.render.ExtrudedPolygon
All Implemented Interfaces:
AVList, Disposable, GeographicExtent, Renderable
public class ExtrudedPolygon
extends AVListImpl
implements GeographicExtent, Disposable

A multi-sided 3D shell formed by a base polygon in latitude and longitude extruded to a specified height. The height is relative to a reference position, designated by one of the specified polygon positions. The extruded polygon is capped with a plane at that height and parallel to the ellipsoid at the reference position. Since positions other than the reference position may resolve to points at elevations other than that of the reference position, the distances from those points to the planar cap are adjusted so that the adjacent sides precisely meet the cap.

Extruded polygons are safe to share among World Windows. They should not be shared among layers in the same World Window.

Nested Class Summary
protected static class ExtrudedPolygon.Cap
          An internal class used to tessellate the polygon itself and produce the indices needed to draw it.

Throws:

Method Detail

computeExtent

protected Extent computeExtent()

computeGeometry

protected Vec4 computeGeometry(DrawContext dc)
Computes the Cartesian coordinates of the shape's vertices and attaches them to the shape. The computed Cartesian coordinates are relative to a reference point, which is also computed and attached to the shape here.

The shape's Cartesian, modelling coordinate extent is also computed here.

Parameters:
dc - the draw context.
Returns:
the computed reference point.
